attributes.action: Greyhounds must be looked after for their full life, not just their racing life.
attributes.background: There are 15000 racing greyhounds in the UK today but over 3500 go 'missing' each year. Last year the greyhound industry netted £1.3billion in profits so owners, racing stadiums and all betting outlets should be forced to pay a greyhound welfare tax to pay for their lifetime care.

rejection.details: We can't accept if your petition in its current form because it does not call for an action which is within the responsibility of the UK Government and Parliament. You could start a new petition calling on Parliament to introduce a welfare tax on the racing industry to help pay for former racing greyhounds who are in rescue centres.
